title: EG: Municipal Economic Benefits Platform
description: A large-scale microservice web-platform offering municipal services regarding requesting, managing, and analysing economic benefit packages offered by the national government to private individuals. The services had a large focus on integrations to other third-party services e.g. taxation systems in order to satisfy their domain functionality. The agile development process included a team of developers (10+), UX designers, testers, and veteran domain experts.

title: Tia Technology: Digital Insurance Platform
description: A web-platform utilising microservices and microfrontends to build a dynamic platform for exposing different sub-domains within a general insurance domain, both for customer self-service and company processes. The platform functioned as a separate system integrating with an existing enterprise exposing the core domain features. The Agile development process consisted of a handful of developers and a few UX designers.

title: Optimise: File Management Platform
description: A web-application facilitating advanced file hosting and management within the domain of construction projects and their complex needs for advanced archive rules, presentation of different document types, and authorization based on user profession. The agile process centered around an out-sourced developer team in India and Poland, with the technical team lead and project management located on-site in Denmark. This project was started after the development cycle had already been on-going for some time and needed better and more streamlined coordination.

title: XMedicus: General Practitioner Platform
description: A web-application for general practitioners and their clients, enabling asynchronous communication between the parties, and handing general coordination with meetings, receipts etc. The project consisted of further development on the existing system, expanding its features and bug fixing.

title: DPOWare: GDPR Compliance Platform
description: A web-application for companies to manage, monitor, and document their GDPR compliance through workflows, checklists, reminders etc. The project constituted the initial release phase of the application, from conception to development and release. The project was developed by a couple of developers with close contact to the stakeholders, which served as the domain experts.

title: Taxin√¶vnet: Administrative Platform
description: A simple CRUD web-application for a company to manage their taxi driver's license information.

title: Maersk Oil Trading: Batch System
description: A small asynchronous batch program handling periodic data-synchronisation between different data sources.

title: Maersk Oil Trading: Resource Management Application
description: This project focused on expanding the features of an existing (internally) mass-deployed desktop application handling resource management and analysis.

title: MSc.Eng Thesis: A Peer-Based Distributed Password Manager
description: Master's thesis application in the form of a password manager with added security through the use of true data fragmentation distribution in a peer-network, decentralizing the application's secret data.

title: B.Eng Project: Clothing Web-Application
description: Simple CRUD web-application, designed and implemented as part of the product for my Bachelor of Engineering project. The business functionality centered around using primitive statistical analysis of user's clothing sizes across different brands, in order to propose possible fitting sizes in new brands as of yet un-used by the user.
